pipr

Source: vignettes/pipr.Rmd
pipr.Rmd
library(pipr)
#> Info: Session based caching is enabled.

The pipr package allows to easily query the PIP API from R.

Here are a few examples to get you started:

Using default options

By default, get_stats() returns all available

  • countries
  • reporting levels (national, urban, rural)
  • for all available survey years
  • at the 1.9 USD poverty line
get_stats()
#> # A tibble: 2,062 × 47
#>    region_code country_code  year reporting_level survey_acronym survey_coverage
#>    <chr>       <chr>        <dbl> <chr>           <chr>          <chr>          
#>  1 SSA         AGO           2000 national        HBS            national       
#>  2 SSA         AGO           2008 national        IBEP-MICS      national       
#>  3 SSA         AGO           2018 national        IDREA          national       
#>  4 ECA         ALB           1996 national        EWS            national       
#>  5 ECA         ALB           2002 national        LSMS           national       
#>  6 ECA         ALB           2005 national        LSMS           national       
#>  7 ECA         ALB           2008 national        LSMS           national       
#>  8 ECA         ALB           2012 national        LSMS           national       
#>  9 ECA         ALB           2014 national        HBS            national       
#> 10 ECA         ALB           2015 national        HBS            national       
#> # … with 2,052 more rows, and 41 more variables: welfare_time <dbl>,
#> #   welfare_type <chr>, survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>,
#> #   poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>,
#> #   gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>,
#> #   decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>,
#> #   decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, survey_mean_lcu <dbl>, …

Basic options

Filter by country 

# Specify ONE country
get_stats(country = "ALB")
#> # A tibble: 9 × 47
#>   region_code country_code  year reporting_level survey_acronym survey_coverage
#>   <chr>       <chr>        <dbl> <chr>           <chr>          <chr>          
#> 1 ECA         ALB           1996 national        EWS            national       
#> 2 ECA         ALB           2002 national        LSMS           national       
#> 3 ECA         ALB           2005 national        LSMS           national       
#> 4 ECA         ALB           2008 national        LSMS           national       
#> 5 ECA         ALB           2012 national        LSMS           national       
#> 6 ECA         ALB           2014 national        HBS            national       
#> 7 ECA         ALB           2015 national        HBS            national       
#> 8 ECA         ALB           2016 national        HBS            national       
#> 9 ECA         ALB           2017 national        HBS            national       
#> # … with 41 more variables: welfare_time <dbl>, welfare_type <chr>,
#> #   survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>,
#> #   headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>,
#> #   mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>,
#> #   decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>,
#> #   decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>, decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>,
#> #   survey_mean_lcu <dbl>, survey_mean_ppp <dbl>, predicted_mean_ppp <dbl>, …
# Specify MULTIPLE countries
get_stats(country = c("ALB", "CHN"))
#> # A tibble: 60 × 47
#>    region_code country_code  year reporting_level survey_acronym survey_coverage
#>    <chr>       <chr>        <dbl> <chr>           <chr>          <chr>          
#>  1 ECA         ALB           1996 national        EWS            national       
#>  2 ECA         ALB           2002 national        LSMS           national       
#>  3 ECA         ALB           2005 national        LSMS           national       
#>  4 ECA         ALB           2008 national        LSMS           national       
#>  5 ECA         ALB           2012 national        LSMS           national       
#>  6 ECA         ALB           2014 national        HBS            national       
#>  7 ECA         ALB           2015 national        HBS            national       
#>  8 ECA         ALB           2016 national        HBS            national       
#>  9 ECA         ALB           2017 national        HBS            national       
#> 10 EAP         CHN           1981 rural           CRHS-CUHS      national       
#> # … with 50 more rows, and 41 more variables: welfare_time <dbl>,
#> #   welfare_type <chr>, survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>,
#> #   poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>,
#> #   gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>,
#> #   decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>,
#> #   decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, survey_mean_lcu <dbl>, …

Filter by year

By default, get_stats will only return data if a survey is available for the requested country and the requested year.

# Survey year available
get_stats(country = "ALB", year = 2012)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 47
#>   region_code country_code  year reporting_level survey_acronym survey_coverage
#>   <chr>       <chr>        <dbl> <chr>           <chr>          <chr>          
#> 1 ECA         ALB           2012 national        LSMS           national       
#> # … with 41 more variables: welfare_time <dbl>, welfare_type <chr>,
#> #   survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>,
#> #   headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>,
#> #   mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>,
#> #   decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>,
#> #   decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>, decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>,
#> #   survey_mean_lcu <dbl>, survey_mean_ppp <dbl>, predicted_mean_ppp <dbl>, …
# Survey year NOT available - Empty response
get_stats(country = "ALB", year = 2000)
#> # A tibble: 0 × 47
#> # … with 47 variables: region_code <chr>, country_code <chr>, year <dbl>,
#> #   reporting_level <chr>, survey_acronym <chr>, survey_coverage <chr>,
#> #   welfare_time <dbl>, welfare_type <chr>, survey_comparability <dbl>,
#> #   comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>,
#> #   median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>,
#> #   decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, …

Modify the poverty line 

get_stats(country = "ALB", povline = 3.2)
#> # A tibble: 9 × 47
#>   region_code country_code  year reporting_level survey_acronym survey_coverage
#>   <chr>       <chr>        <dbl> <chr>           <chr>          <chr>          
#> 1 ECA         ALB           1996 national        EWS            national       
#> 2 ECA         ALB           2002 national        LSMS           national       
#> 3 ECA         ALB           2005 national        LSMS           national       
#> 4 ECA         ALB           2008 national        LSMS           national       
#> 5 ECA         ALB           2012 national        LSMS           national       
#> 6 ECA         ALB           2014 national        HBS            national       
#> 7 ECA         ALB           2015 national        HBS            national       
#> 8 ECA         ALB           2016 national        HBS            national       
#> 9 ECA         ALB           2017 national        HBS            national       
#> # … with 41 more variables: welfare_time <dbl>, welfare_type <chr>,
#> #   survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>,
#> #   headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>,
#> #   mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>,
#> #   decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>,
#> #   decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>, decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>,
#> #   survey_mean_lcu <dbl>, survey_mean_ppp <dbl>, predicted_mean_ppp <dbl>, …

Other features

Get estimates when survey year is not available

The fill_gaps argument will trigger the interpolation / extrapolation of poverty estimates when survey year is not available.

# fill_gaps = FALSE (default)
get_stats(country = "HTI")
#> # A tibble: 2 × 47
#>   region_code country_code  year reporting_level survey_acronym survey_coverage
#>   <chr>       <chr>        <dbl> <chr>           <chr>          <chr>          
#> 1 LAC         HTI           2001 national        ECVH           national       
#> 2 LAC         HTI           2012 national        ECVMAS         national       
#> # … with 41 more variables: welfare_time <dbl>, welfare_type <chr>,
#> #   survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>, poverty_line <dbl>,
#> #   headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>, poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>,
#> #   mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>, gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>,
#> #   decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>, decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>,
#> #   decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>, decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>,
#> #   survey_mean_lcu <dbl>, survey_mean_ppp <dbl>, predicted_mean_ppp <dbl>, …
# fill_gaps = TRUE
get_stats(country = "HTI", fill_gaps = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 29 × 47
#>    region_code country_code  year reporting_level survey_acronym survey_coverage
#>    <chr>       <chr>        <int> <chr>           <chr>          <chr>          
#>  1 LAC         HTI           1981 national        NA             NA             
#>  2 LAC         HTI           1982 national        NA             NA             
#>  3 LAC         HTI           1983 national        NA             NA             
#>  4 LAC         HTI           1984 national        NA             NA             
#>  5 LAC         HTI           1985 national        NA             NA             
#>  6 LAC         HTI           1986 national        NA             NA             
#>  7 LAC         HTI           1987 national        NA             NA             
#>  8 LAC         HTI           1988 national        NA             NA             
#>  9 LAC         HTI           1989 national        NA             NA             
#> 10 LAC         HTI           1990 national        NA             NA             
#> # … with 19 more rows, and 41 more variables: welfare_time <dbl>,
#> #   welfare_type <chr>, survey_comparability <dbl>, comparable_spell <chr>,
#> #   poverty_line <dbl>, headcount <dbl>, poverty_gap <dbl>,
#> #   poverty_severity <dbl>, watts <dbl>, mean <dbl>, median <dbl>, mld <dbl>,
#> #   gini <dbl>, polarization <dbl>, decile1 <dbl>, decile2 <dbl>,
#> #   decile3 <dbl>, decile4 <dbl>, decile5 <dbl>, decile6 <dbl>, decile7 <dbl>,
#> #   decile8 <dbl>, decile9 <dbl>, decile10 <dbl>, survey_mean_lcu <dbl>, …

Compute custom aggregates

get_stats() can also be used to compute aggregate welfare statistics of custom group of countries.

# World Bank aggregate
get_stats(country = "all", subgroup = "wb_regions")

# Custom aggregate
get_stats(country = c("CHL", "ARG", "BOL"), subgroup = "none")
